transcript.sentence: Sheets of paper fly through the air.
Then words appear. Great. Educators and animators collaborating to create ted ed lessons worth sharing.
A single feather floats in the air.
A close up of a feather shows the detail, followed by an egret bird spreading its wings in the air.
Words appear, tree of life next to an artistically drawn tree. Then a drawing of a young boy perched upon a tree
next to an ape on another branch.
A line is drawn with several primate looking forms as they progressively become upright. And finally human.
An equation is written with drawings. Dinosaur equals bird, question mark.
The dinosaur drawing fades into an x ray of the dinosaur skeleton with the wishbone highlighted.
Sand is wiped away to reveal the fossil of a dinosaur with a long tail. The fossil is magnified to show the spine, which appears feather like.
Images of different dinosaur fossils cover the screen.
A young boy, crouch is near a pigeon the pigeon grows to the size of a large dinosaur in startles the boy.
A family tree with various dinosaur pictures. And the title arc a sores.
Images of the progression of feathers are shown from a simple feather with a single branch and so on, until there are many fine branches, like the hairs of a feather.
A drawing of a bird with dense feathers.
A fossilized feather is magnified to show the molecules called
milan assumes.
Black crows fly across the sky. Then an image of red paint splotches.
A drawing of a bird's arms shrink into its chest, and its body swells larger.
The woodcock blends into the bush.
The ostrich hovers above its baby birds.
A peacock fans open its feathers next to another peacock.
A dinosaur walks on the ground, then morphs into a bird and flies away.
The dinosaur attempts to walk up a steep incline with great difficulty. Then it is finally able to walk up
when the arms are simulated to grow longer with wings.
The dinosaur family tree.
Then the modern bird flies out of the tree.
Lesson by carl zimmer. Narration by carl zimmer,
animation by amelia liang,
w w w dot kiwi mella dot com k I w I m e l l a dot com.
Ted ed lessons worth sharing. View full lesson on ed dot ted dot com,
nominate an educator, recommend an anime to submit a lesson.
Words appear great. Educators and animators collaborating to create
small images tumble past.
They fit into a drawing of a head.
More words, ted ed,
lessons worth sharing.
The images become animated.
A crane aloft.
Words tree of life, a drawing of a tree with a round canopy
on separate branches of feather, a child, a chimpanzee,
On a line, a hunched primate,
a larger primate, more upright,
more upright, still with a smaller head,
a humanoid figure with a hairy head,
a human a cartoon human fully clothed
beneath a white feather.
Question marks beside the feather.
Animated t rex equals a plump bird.
X rays of the two.
Of fossil. The feathers are magnified.
More fossils.
The cartoon child next to a small dinosaur.
On the tree oval of dinosaurs and the plump modern bird a label arches sores.
A single fossil feather,
a magnified section, a word milan, a sums.
The modern bird flies from the tree.
